ratings.comment: He should get a higher score here. Followed by the last comment, he also examine definitions via quizzes, which I think is an effective way to learn!

My largest mistake is choose his MATH 341. The other section 80% is A and take home exam, and the other prof 85% AB while 90%A. This guy does not give AB. Hard final exam. He will leave our school and hope he will never come back!
Nice professor. Btw he's so hot
ridiculously hard final exam

Tough grader. It seems that students cannot make mistakes during the tests. The last question tends to be hard. The definition is memory-based, and you will definitely do badly if you forget. There may not be AB in his class as A is 90 and AB is 88! But he is caring. At least he will give us questionnaire to ask our feeling

Ppl hate on profs just bc they got a bad grade. Our RAW average was lower than the other class but the final grade distribution was the same... so Idk why ppl are complaining about "not curving". He's fine, though he needs to get better TAs. Only critique is him putting a problem on the exam that is "different" from what we have done in class.
The homework and exam is too difficult.

People just like to complain about the teacher when they don't get a good grade. He's a good teacher. Very accessible outside of class and willing to help. Pretty good at explaining things but he sort of just repeats ZyBooks so lectures aren't really necessary. Decent

Antoine was a great professor. He was always ready to help, responded to emails incredibly fast, and kept lectures interesting and enjoyable. The only downside is that his class was substantially harder than the other section. But, while our exams and homework where tougher, an A was not impossible. He's a good choice for 240, you will learn a lot.

Have you ever taken a class and thought, "Wow, I wonder what my professor's favorite European football player is"? Well, good news! Antoine will not hesitate to let you know in the form of lectures I genuinely enjoyed going to.
Some topics were criminally under-explained and were given a big emphasis on homework and quizzes, but the class was fine.

This class is substantially harder than the other section. The homework contains more and harder questions than the other section. Tests are only proofs where as other sections test has multiple choice, fill in the blank, short answer, etc. Average on the first exam was 15% lower than the other class but he refused to curve it. Avoid at all costs

1. The difficulty of his section is significantly higher than other sections.(this is not too bad)
2. Terrible hand writing
3. Tough grader, as a math major taking his course, his grading on proof is way too hard for this class at low level. I would recommend taking his other classes(Math classes), but he is really not a good fir for this class.

The midterm was ridiculously hard and expected us to memorize many definitions and example problems. His communication is also lacking. He says there will not be a curve, but also says a 25/30 is an A?
The other section has optional assignments, easier exams, and a higher average. I recommend taking another professor for this class.
Easiest professor at the University of Wisconsin. It is worth taking if you want an easy 'A' but do not care about learning the material
Very good professor. Antoine clearly cares a lot about his students. Amazing and engaging lectures and office hours are incredibly helpful
Avoid. Stopped going to lecture after one (1) month. Better off learning material on your own

By far my favorite professor-really an amazing teacher. He's super friendly and it's clear from taking his class that he truly cares about his students and that he's really passionate about teaching. He makes the material easy to understand with lots of examples. If you have the opportunity to take a class with Antoine, you 100% should.

Antoine is by far the best professor I've had so far at UW. His lectures were clear, well-organized, and easy to follow. In class, he never failed to make sure students felt comfortable asking questions. Although he didn't necessarily "teach to the test", homework and weekly quizzes were reasonable and really helped prepare us for the exams.

Antoine is a fantastic professor. He clearly cares about all his students. He was very accomodating when I missed some lectures, and he answers many questions during lectures. If you do the homework, participate in class, and take advantage of the resources provided (Piazza, office hours, etc.) it's not hard to get a good grade. Highly recommend.

I enjoyed taking Math421 with Antoine! Math 421 is a hard course for sure, but Antoine made clear notes and his classes were easy to follow. He is a pretty nice person and would love to provide help outside the classroom. But the exams are kind of hard(i'm not a math major student) for me. Learnt a lot from this course!

ANTOINE is a good person, not good at teaching . Math 421 is not an easy class, he doesn't know how to let his student understand to solve the problem even though he knows. I don't recommend taking his class if you have another choice.
